alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:50PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CHOCTAW...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN CLARKE AND NORTHERN WAYNE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM CDT... At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Lisman to 4 miles north of Toxey to 3 miles northwest of Barnett. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Butler, Millry, Silas, Coffeeville, Gilbertown, and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
